item.title: Job vacancies surge past one million in new record
item.description: Official figures show the number of vacancies top one million for the first time since records began in 2001.

item.title: Ocado says delivery driver wage rise to cost it up to £5m
item.description: The online food delivery is the latest to offer increased wages amid a shortage of lorry drivers.

item.title: Brexit: Checks on goods imported from the EU delayed again
item.description: The government blames Covid and supply chain difficulties as it puts back changes.

item.title: Scrap Covid tests for most travellers, says industry
item.description: The government has "choked off" travel trade and 70% of firms plan redundancies, says Abta.

item.title: Apple rushes to block 'zero-click' iPhone spyware
item.description: The flaw allows hackers to access devices even if users do not click on a link or file.

item.title: Tesco zero-waste trial launches at 10 stores in England
item.description: The trial will enable shoppers to buy certain products in reusable packaging they can return to stores.

item.title: Evergrande: Shares in cash-strapped China property giant plunge
item.description: Evergrande has also seen a rare protest staged by investors at its headquarters in Shenzhen.

item.title: Democrats propose partial rollback of Trump tax cuts
item.description: Under new plans, corporate and income tax would rise for the richest companies and individuals.

item.title: Emma Raducanu set to earn millions after US Open win
item.description: Brands will be queuing up to secure sponsorship deals with the teenage tennis star, experts say.

item.title: Fake Walmart news release claimed it would accept cryptocurrency
item.description: A news story claiming Walmart would accept cryptocurrency Litecoin was fabricated, the retail giant says.

item.title: Primark says leggings still popular as comfort rules
item.description: The discount fashion chain says shoppers are still stocking up on cycle shorts and seam-free clothes.

item.title: UK scraps Covid-19 vaccine deal with French firm Valneva
item.description: The French firm says the deal was cancelled over allegations of a breach of the agreement, which it denies.

item.title: TUC says 'proper pay rise' would fix shortages problem
item.description: Higher wages for workers is key to building a strong economic recovery, says Frances O'Grady.

item.title: Politeness leaving people at the mercy of fraudsters
item.description: Banks warn that people do not want to appear rude rather than cutting off unsolicited phone calls.

item.title: Brewdog picks new chairman after worker criticism
item.description: Allan Leighton joins the Aberdeenshire brewing firm which had been hit by criticism from former employees.

item.title: Covid: Legal action begins over quarantine hotel rules
item.description: A law firm representing travellers is taking the government to court over the UK's quarantine hotel policy.

item.title: British American Tobacco negotiated bribe for Mugabe, new evidence suggests
item.description: Documents reveal British American Tobacco’s role in bribery and spying in southern Africa.

item.title: Alibaba slides on report China plans to break up payment app
item.description: Chinese regulators have been targeting Ant Group and other technology firms operating in the country.

item.title: Cressida Dick: Tech giants make it impossible to stop terrorists
item.description: Pressure on tech firms intensifies as Priti Patel unveils fund for technologies to keep children safe.

item.title: The pressures - and rewards - of being an influencer
item.description: Running your own popular YouTube channel can be lucrative, but it comes with downsides.

item.title: The epicentre of Britain's pandemic house price boom
item.description: House prices have surged in many parts of the UK - and in one district they have risen by 29% in a year.

item.title: Could a reboot make social media a nicer place?
item.description: A Harvard University project will explore whether social media can be de-toxed

item.title: Women's state pension: 'It is like you've lived one big lie'
item.description: How women born in the 1950s had their retirement plans upended by state pension age changes.

item.title: How a monkey launched the pop-it toy craze
item.description: Why it took a TikTok primate to turn a forty-year-old idea into a global hit

item.title: The models that turned Instagram into their DIY catwalk
item.description: New York Fashion Week marks a tentative return - but how did supermodels keep working through Covid?

item.title: CEO Secrets: The bra boss busting stereotypes
item.description: Leanne Cahill, CEO of Bravissimo, shares her journey from shop floor to boardroom in retail.

item.title: Why coders love the AI that could put them out of a job
item.description: Artificial intelligence is getting better at penning code but still a long way from working alone.

item.title: Has Covid killed off business cards for good?
item.description: Sales of business cards have fallen sharply as a result of the pandemic.
